faqs.question: How much is it to repair a roof?
faqs.answer: Most home owners spend between $300 and $1,100 for a roof repair, or an average of $650 per repair call. Typically, a job is to repair leaks. Seal the leak, replace shingles, seal the shingles. If there is a small area and few shingles being repaired, it will likely be on the low end, or as little as $150.

faqs.question: How do you repair a damaged roof?
faqs.answer: Replacing Roof Shingles. Slip a flat pry bar under the damaged shingle and press down to pop out the roofing nails. Fix Curled Roof Shingle Corners with Caulking. Slide the new shingle up into place. Cracked Roof Shingles Repair. Carefully lift the upper shingle and secure the new shingle with roofing nails.

faqs.question: Can a handyman repair a roof?
faqs.answer: To start things off, a handyman can definitely handle small repairs on your roof. The next time your handyman comes over for a project, ask him or her whether they can take a look at your roof.

faqs.question: How do you seal a leaking roof?
faqs.answer: To repair leaks caused by metal flashing around chimneys and dormers, simply reseal joints using a caulk gun filled with roofing cement. If you see damage to joints previously sealed with a line of roof cement, apply a fresh new coat with a putty knife.

faqs.question: Does homeowners insurance cover roof repair?
faqs.answer: Homeowners insurance may cover a roof leak if it is caused by a covered peril. Suppose your roof is damaged by fire, hail or wind. However, homeowners insurance generally does not cover damage resulting from lack of maintenance or wear and tear. Instead, it typically helps pay to repair sudden, accidental damage.

blogPosts.headline: What Is Siding And What Does It Do For Your Home’s Roofing?
blogPosts.author: Bryce Coleman
blogPosts.articleBody: Your home’s roof is the first line of defense against weather and pests. It can’t do its job without proper support, which comes from your siding. Siding is a protective layer covering the wall surface and provides insulation between your exterior sheathing and interior walls to help reduce drafts in your home. There are many different types of materials used to cover our walls like vinyl, aluminum, wood, or brick; Vinyl Vinyl has become one of the most popular exterior wall covering options because its low cost doesn’t compromise durability or aesthetic appeal compared to other material choices on the market today. Vinyl comes in many different colors and designs that will fit with any home style. You can find this material at most local hardware stores, where you’ll also be able to purchase vinyl accessories like flashing, trimming, and railing systems for your project! Aluminum Aluminum has a sleek look and is an excellent conductor of heat, so it’s great for climates with cold winters because its thermal properties help keep additional warmth inside your home rather than out on the exterior surface (which then gets absorbed by surrounding snow). With Aluminum siding make sure you get the right type of paint to protect it against harsh weather conditions. Wood Wood is one of the most traditional materials used for siding and comes in many different colors that can be stained or painted any way you like! One downside with wood is that it’s not durable enough to last more than two years without regular maintenance. Therefore, repairing damage, repainting, or replacing boards regularly may become necessary. Another disadvantage is that wooden siding needs increased space from your home’s outer walls, which requires expensive framing work before installation. When installing this material, ensure you’re using quality lumber because cheaply made boards will warp, crack or split. Brick Brick is a heavy material, so you’ll need to use additional framing support (such as steel) when installing it against your home’s exterior walls. This investment pays off in durability and style because brick siding lasts much longer than other materials, including vinyl, aluminum, and wood! Brick helps insulate the interior of your home, which means less money spent on heating costs each year too. Just make sure you’re using quality bricks that are structurally sound. Cheap versions may be lightweight and more easily damaged by elements like hail, ice, or fire, so beware before investing in this type of material for your home! While each material has its advantages and disadvantages, the decision is ultimately up to you as a homeowner. Just make sure that whatever siding you choose will last for at least 20 years, so your house looks great for many more decades ahead. Installing durable siding on your house comes with numerous benefits. They include; Protection from weather damage – Like the roof, siding is an integral part of your home’s structure. It can protect both you and your property in a variety of ways. Not only does it keep out water, but also leaves and tree sap when they are blown by wind or rain. These substances can cause significant damage to your house exterior if not prevented with good quality vinyl siding! Curb Appeal – One of the best benefits of new siding on your home is that it can provide you with a fresh and updated look. It has many different styles to choose from, so finding one for your home’s needs should be easy! Durability – Quality siding will last for years before needing replacement or repair. This makes it an excellent choice if you are looking for something less costly in terms of maintenance Interior Benefits – Sidings like vinyl siding add value to your home’s interior. Because it is from eco-friendly materials. Vinyl does not release toxins or cause allergies like other types of finishes might! Installing siding services If you are looking for a reliable professional to install your house sidings, Advosy is the place to be for top-notch services. Our installation process begins by assessing the exterior of your home. What does it look like? Are there any holes, cracks, and damage that need repair before you start on siding installation? If so, we begin giving an estimate for the repairs and then go ahead to handle the task. Once repairs are complete, the next thing is usually choosing colors and styles based on what will work well with your home’s design. Our professionals consult with family members about their thoughts, if possible, as they may be able to add some insight, which could inspire color choices outside as well. Besides installation, relying on Advosy gives you a lifetime partner for any future repairs, inspection, maintenance, or any inquiries you might have. We offer flawless services at very affordable rates. Contact us today to schedule your appointment.

blogPosts.headline: Roofing Buyer’s Guide
blogPosts.author: Bryce Coleman
blogPosts.articleBody: Roofing Buyer’s Guide It’s an exciting time in your life! You’ve been dreaming of this day for a long time now, and you know that it is just around the corner. Your first thoughts are about what colors to paint the walls or what kind of furniture you should buy. But one thing that deserves serious consideration before moving forward with your move is roofing. How much does roof replacement cost? What should I look for in a good quality shingle? Is re-roofing my home worth it? These are all important questions to ask yourself as well as those who will be helping you make these decisions going forward. The last thing you want to do is spend all of your hard-earned money on a new home only to have nothing but trouble with the roofing. This buyer’s guide is intended to give you a much better idea of what to expect from your investment and how best to go about choosing the right kind of roof for your new home. There are many things that need consideration when it comes to this vital part of your newly purchased property, so sit back, grab a warm drink and relax. This guide is going to give you the knowledge and power to make an educated decision about your future roofing plans. Spotting Potential Roofing Trouble It’s important to have an idea about what risks you may be facing prior to making your final purchase. Not all roofing is created equally, and some of the shingles out there are not going to last very long. You want something that will hold up for a long time, so it’s best to do some research beforehand. The easiest way to ensure this kind of longevity is by doing a bit of homework on any potential homes before even stepping foot inside. If you know anyone living in the area or who has lived there for a while, ask them if they would mind sharing their experiences with local roofing contractors and service providers. This could save you hundreds or thousands of dollars over time if you find issues early on and can get those problems corrected before you even make your purchase. The cost of a new roof is often higher than some people expect, but if you take the time to check around for costs from different roofing contractors in your area, you can get an idea about how much a quality home ought to run. Keep in mind that most contracts include professional cleanup and disposal of any refuse left behind during the process. This helps ensure that you won’t end up with anything extra to worry about once your old roof has been hauled away and replaced by a beautiful new one! Tearing Off The Old Roof Replacing an existing roof is not a difficult or time-consuming process. Anyone with basic construction skills and good physical fitness can perform this task if given the proper training and tools. Of course, it goes without saying that you should avoid doing any work on your own unless you are certain about what you’re doing. If at all possible, hire a professional to do the job for you! Not only will they save you money in the long run by doing it correctly the first time, but they also provide full guarantee of their workmanship. This means that they are willing to stand behind everything that they did for as long as necessary. This is especially important considering how easy it can be to damage a roof during installation if certain safety standards are not met. Basic Roofing Types There are many different materials that can be used in roofing, and each of them offers various benefits. It is important to identify your needs when shopping for a new roof so that you know what kind of material will serve you best in the end. Here’s a quick breakdown on some of the most basic types: Asphalt These roofs are generally considered to be one of the least expensive options out there, but they come with their own set of drawbacks. They often get damaged during high winds and heavy rains due to their relative thinness. However, if you have a good contractor do the work, asphalt can make a solid roofing option regardless. Tile This is quite possibly the longest lasting roofing option available today. Tile comes in a huge variety of shapes, sizes and colors. It can also be used on both commercial and residential buildings alike without any major problems. The most expensive part of tile roofing is the installation costs, but it’s well worth it in the end. Metal This kind roofing material has become increasingly popular over the past several years because of its high durability and cost-effectiveness. It offers excellent water resistance as well as protection from fire and wind damage due to its thick aluminum composition. Slate This type of roof comprises individual pieces that are carefully waxed to help prevent moisture build up within the surface layers. Slate works extremely well for very steep roofs that have high levels of foot traffic or snowfall. The biggest drawback for slate is that it can be quite heavy and expensive to install. Wood This roofing material has a very long history, but its popularity has waned over the years as other options have become more affordable. However, wood still makes a great potential choice due to its natural beauty and high level of flexibility in terms of style. It’s important to use plywood or other stronger materials for this type of home since they typically need support from underneath. Roof Repair Costs One of the most common reasons why people end up needing a new roof is because their current one just isn’t performing as well as it used to. Roof leaks are often caused by cracks and other damage that occurs over time, and this is why regular inspection and repair play such an important role in keeping your roof in good condition. The cost of repairs can vary significantly from one situation to the next, but they’re generally quite affordable when compared with other types of home improvement projects. The most effective way to ensure that you won’t spend more than necessary on repairs is by learning as much as possible about potential problems before they have a chance to happen! Roofing Styles and Shapes Although there are many different materials available for use in flat roofs today, most homes still end up with some kind of basic tile or asphalt composition. Flats can be built using anything from concrete tiling to individual pieces of natural stone. They also come in a huge variety of shapes to match specific home designs, although the rectangle is probably the most common shape overall. Do you have a pitched roof? These are generally much more difficult for new and inexperienced contractors to install because they involve a decent amount of climbing in order to make sure that all angles are properly secured. The main problem with many pitches is that there’s simply not enough surface area for tiling or shingles, which means that alternative materials must be used instead. This type of situation often leads to an increased need for high-level maintenance even after installation is complete, so it’s definitely worth looking into these issues before hiring anyone for your own project!
